DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Most Recent Stem Cell Infusion Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The specification of the patient's most recent type of stem cell infusion or transplant received.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Most Recent Stem Cell Infusion Procedure Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Nearest to the present._Relatively undifferentiated cells of the same lineage (family type) that retain the ability to divide throughout postnatal life to reproduce themselves and to give rise to other more specialized types of cells to take the place of those that die or are lost. (MeSH)_A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Most Recent Stem Cell Infusion Procedure Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Nearest to the present.:Relatively undifferentiated cells of the same lineage (family type) that retain the ability to divide throughout postnatal life to reproduce themselves and to give rise to other more specialized types of cells to take the place of those that die or are lost. (MeSH):A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: An unspecialized cell that has the capacity for reproduction through cell division and can be induced to differentiate into a tissue or organ specific cell.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the type of blood or blood products into a blood vessel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exchange of like DNA sequences on homologous chromosomes by recombination.

Concepts.definition: The process of exchange of genetic material between autonomous replicons, which depends on regions of extensive sequence homology between the participating DNA strands. This process involves double-strand breakage of one participant, resection of the break, and strand invasion, followed by formation, displacement and resolution of the Holliday junction. This process is involved in repairing broken DNA and creating combinations of genes that may be unique from the parent duplexes. Disruptions in this process can result in inviability, premature aging and predisposition to cancers and degenerative diseases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (aw-TAHL-o-gus) Taken from an individual's own tissues, cells, or DNA.

Concepts.definition: Taken from an individual's own tissues, cells, or DNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Taken from different individuals of the same species.  Also called allogeneic.

Concepts.definition: Taken from different individuals of the same species.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of therapy in which lymphocytes from the blood of a donor are given to a patient who has already received a stem cell transplant from the same donor. The donor lymphocytes may kill remaining cancer cells. Donor lymphocyte infusion is used to treat chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) that has come back and myeloma. It is being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: The infusion of donor lymphocytes following hematopoietic stem cell transplantation for the purpose of augmenting the host immune response or preventing the rejection of the graft.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The administration of blood or blood products into a blood vessel.:Any stepwise set of actions.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
